title: BrazilDataAPI: Access Brazilian Data via APIs and Curated Datasets
text: BrazilDataAPI package provides unified interface access open data BrasilAPI, REST Countries API, Nager.Date API, World Bank API, focus Brazil. allows users easily retrieve --date information postal codes, banks, economic indicators, holidays, company registrations, international country-level data, public holidays information, economic development data relevant Brazil. addition API-access functions, package includes collection curated datasets related Brazil, covering diverse domains demographics (male female population state year), river levels Manaus, environmental emission factors São Paulo, Brazilian film festivals, historical yellow fever outbreaks. BrazilDataAPI designed support research, teaching, data analysis focused Brazil integrating public RESTful APIs high-quality, domain-specific datasets multiple domains single, easy--use R package.

title: BrazilDataAPI: Access Brazilian Data via APIs and Curated Datasets
text: BrazilDataAPI package provides several core functions access real-time structured information Brazil public APIs BrasilAPI, REST Countries, Nager.Date API, World Bank API. list main functions included package: get_brazil_banks(): Get List Banks Brazil get_brazil_cep(): Get Address Information Brazilian CEP (Postal Code) Example: get_brazil_cep(“89010025”) get_brazil_cnpj(): Get Company Information CNPJ (Brazil) Example: get_brazil_cnpj(“19131243000197”) get_brazil_municipalities(): Get Municipalities Brazilian State IBGE Example: get_brazil_municipalities(“SP”) get_brazil_rate_name(): Get Specific Brazilian Economic Rate Name Example: get_brazil_rate_name(“CDI”) get_brazil_rates(): Get Official Interest Rates Indexes Brazil get_brazil_vehicle_brands(): Get Vehicle Brands BrasilAPI (FIPE Data) Example: get_brazil_vehicle_brands(“motos”),get_brazil_vehicle_brands(“caminhoes”) get_country_info_br(): Get key country information Brazil. get_brazil_child_mortality(): Get Brazil’s -5 Mortality Rate data World Bank. get_brazil_cpi(): Get Brazil’s Consumer Price Index (2010 = 100) data World Bank. get_brazil_energy_use(): Get Brazil’s Energy Use (kg oil equivalent per capita) data World Bank. get_brazil_gdp(): Get Brazil’s GDP (current US$) data World Bank. get_brazil_hospital_beds(): Get Brazil’s Hospital Beds (per 1,000 people) data World Bank. get_brazil_life_expectancy(): Get Brazil’s Life Expectancy Birth data World Bank. get_brazil_literacy_rate(): Get Brazil’s Adult Literacy Rate data World Bank. get_brazil_population(): Get Brazil’s Total Population data World Bank. get_brazil_unemployment(): Get Brazil’s Total Unemployment Rate data World Bank. get_brazil_holidays(): Get official public holidays Brazil given year, e.g., get_brazil_holidays(2025). view_datasets_BrazilDataAPI(): Lists curated datasets included BrazilDataAPI package functions allow users access high-quality structured information Brazil, can combined tools like dplyr, tidyr, ggplot2 support wide range data analysis visualization tasks. following sections, ’ll find examples work BrazilDataAPI practical scenarios.

what: List official interest rates and indexes from the BrasilAPI
title: BrazilDataAPI: Access Brazilian Data via APIs and Curated Datasets
code: # Retrieves official interest rates and indexes from the BrazilAPI  brazil_rates_001 <- get_brazil_rates()  print(brazil_rates_001) #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   nome  valor #>   <chr> <dbl> #> 1 Selic 15    #> 2 CDI   14.9  #> 3 IPCA   5.13

what: Get Vehicle Brands from BrasilAPI (FIPE Data)
title: BrazilDataAPI: Access Brazilian Data via APIs and Curated Datasets
code: # A string indicating the type of vehicle. Must be one of "carros", "motos", or "caminhoes".  brazil_vehicles <- get_brazil_vehicle_brands("motos")  print(brazil_vehicles) #> # A tibble: 96 × 2 #>    nome     valor #>    <chr>    <chr> #>  1 ADLY     60    #>  2 AGRALE   61    #>  3 APRILIA  62    #>  4 ATALA    63    #>  5 BAJAJ    64    #>  6 BETA     65    #>  7 BIMOTA   66    #>  8 BMW      67    #>  9 BRANDY   68    #> 10 byCristo 69    #> # ℹ 86 more rows

what: Get Municipalities of a Brazilian State
title: BrazilDataAPI: Access Brazilian Data via APIs and Curated Datasets
code: # A two-letter string representing the Brazilian state abbreviation (e.g., "SP", "RJ", "BA").  brazil_Municipalities <- get_brazil_municipalities("SP")  print(brazil_Municipalities) #> # A tibble: 645 × 2 #>    nome                   codigo_ibge #>    <chr>                  <chr>       #>  1 ADAMANTINA             3500105     #>  2 ADOLFO                 3500204     #>  3 AGUAÍ                  3500303     #>  4 ÁGUAS DA PRATA         3500402     #>  5 ÁGUAS DE LINDÓIA       3500501     #>  6 ÁGUAS DE SANTA BÁRBARA 3500550     #>  7 ÁGUAS DE SÃO PEDRO     3500600     #>  8 AGUDOS                 3500709     #>  9 ALAMBARI               3500758     #> 10 ALFREDO MARCONDES      3500808     #> # ℹ 635 more rows

what: Brazil’s GDP (Current US$) from World Bank 2022 - 2017
title: BrazilDataAPI: Access Brazilian Data via APIs and Curated Datasets
code: brazil_gdp <- head(get_brazil_gdp())  print(brazil_gdp) #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>   indicator         country  year   value value_label       #>   <chr>             <chr>   <int>   <dbl> <chr>             #> 1 GDP (current US$) Brazil   2022 1.95e12 1,951,923,942,083 #> 2 GDP (current US$) Brazil   2021 1.67e12 1,670,647,398,905 #> 3 GDP (current US$) Brazil   2020 1.48e12 1,476,107,231,310 #> 4 GDP (current US$) Brazil   2019 1.87e12 1,873,288,205,060 #> 5 GDP (current US$) Brazil   2018 1.92e12 1,916,933,898,011 #> 6 GDP (current US$) Brazil   2017 2.06e12 2,063,514,977,366

what: Brazil’s Life Expectancy at Birth from World Bank 2022 - 2017
title: BrazilDataAPI: Access Brazilian Data via APIs and Curated Datasets
code: brazil_life_expectancy <- head(get_brazil_life_expectancy())  print(brazil_life_expectancy) #> # A tibble: 6 × 4 #>   indicator                               country  year value #>   <chr>                                   <chr>   <int> <dbl> #> 1 Life expectancy at birth, total (years) Brazil   2022  74.9 #> 2 Life expectancy at birth, total (years) Brazil   2021  73.0 #> 3 Life expectancy at birth, total (years) Brazil   2020  74.5 #> 4 Life expectancy at birth, total (years) Brazil   2019  75.8 #> 5 Life expectancy at birth, total (years) Brazil   2018  75.6 #> 6 Life expectancy at birth, total (years) Brazil   2017  75.4

what: Female Deaths by Age Group in Brazil
title: BrazilDataAPI: Access Brazilian Data via APIs and Curated Datasets
code: # Summarize total deaths by age and year df_plot <- Brasil_females_df %>%   group_by(year1, age) %>%   summarise(total_deaths = sum(deaths, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop")  # Plot: Deaths by age group over time ggplot(df_plot, aes(x = age, y = total_deaths, color = as.factor(year1))) +   geom_line(size = 1) +   labs(     title = "Female Deaths by Age Group in Brazil",     subtitle = "Aggregated by year (year1)",     x = "Age",     y = "Number of Deaths",     color = "Year"   ) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     plot.title = element_text(face = "bold", size = 14),     legend.position = "bottom"   )

title: BrazilDataAPI: Access Brazilian Data via APIs and Curated Datasets
text: dataset BrazilDataAPI labeled suffix indicate structure type: _df: standard data frame. _ts: time series object. _list: list object.

title: BrazilDataAPI: Access Brazilian Data via APIs and Curated Datasets
text: addition API access functions, BrazilDataAPI provides several preloaded datasets offering insights Brazil’s demographic structure, environmental conditions, cultural events, public health records. featured examples: Brasil_females_df: Brazilian Female Demographics & Mortality data frame containing population counts mortality information females Brazil, disaggregated federal states abridged age groups, years 1991 2000. manaus_ts: Monthly Average Heights Rio Negro Manaus univariate time series monthly average river heights Rio Negro Manaus. series contains 1080 observations spanning 90 years, January 1903 December 1992. Yellow_Fever_list: Yellow Fever Outbreak Brazil list object containing information flow Yellow Fever cases five Brazilian states outbreak period December 2016 May 2017.

title: BrazilDataAPI: Access Brazilian Data via APIs and Curated Datasets
text: BrazilDataAPI package provides robust set tools access open data Brazil RESTful APIs curated datasets. includes functions retrieve information postal codes, banks, economic rates, company registrations, holidays via BrasilAPI, international country indicators REST Countries API, public holidays information Nager.Date API, economic development data World Bank API. Additionally, offers preloaded datasets Brazil’s male female population state year, film festivals, São Paulo’s emission factors, river data Manaus, records yellow fever outbreaks.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Renzo Caceres Rossi. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Caceres Rossi R (2025). BrazilDataAPI: Access Brazilian Data via APIs Curated Datasets. R package version 0.2.0, https://github.com/lightbluetitan/brazildataapi.

title: Access Brazilian Data via APIs and Curated Datasets
text: get_brazil_banks(): Get List Banks Brazil get_brazil_cep(): Get Address Information Brazilian CEP (Postal Code) Example: get_brazil_cep(“89010025”) get_brazil_cnpj(): Get Company Information CNPJ (Brazil) Example: get_brazil_cnpj(“19131243000197”) get_brazil_municipalities(): Get Municipalities Brazilian State IBGE Example: get_brazil_municipalities(“SP”) get_brazil_rate_name(): Get Specific Brazilian Economic Rate Name Example: get_brazil_rate_name(“CDI”) get_brazil_rates(): Get Official Interest Rates Indexes Brazil get_brazil_vehicle_brands(): Get Vehicle Brands BrasilAPI (FIPE Data) Example: get_brazil_vehicle_brands(“motos”),get_brazil_vehicle_brands(“caminhoes”) get_country_info(): Get essential information Brazil country full name Example: get_country_info(“Brazil”),get_country_info(“brazil”),get_country_info(“Peru”) get_country_info_br(): Get key country information Brazil. get_brazil_child_mortality(): Get Brazil’s -5 Mortality Rate data World Bank. get_brazil_cpi(): Get Brazil’s Consumer Price Index (2010 = 100) data World Bank. get_brazil_energy_use(): Get Brazil’s Energy Use (kg oil equivalent per capita) data World Bank. get_brazil_gdp(): Get Brazil’s GDP (current US$) data World Bank. get_brazil_hospital_beds(): Get Brazil’s Hospital Beds (per 1,000 people) data World Bank. get_brazil_life_expectancy(): Get Brazil’s Life Expectancy Birth data World Bank. get_brazil_literacy_rate(): Get Brazil’s Adult Literacy Rate data World Bank. get_brazil_population(): Get Brazil’s Total Population data World Bank. get_brazil_unemployment(): Get Brazil’s Total Unemployment Rate data World Bank. get_brazil_holidays(): Get official public holidays Brazil given year, e.g., get_brazil_holidays(2025). view_datasets_BrazilDataAPI(): Lists curated datasets included BrazilDataAPI package

title: Access Brazilian Data via APIs and Curated Datasets
text: naming convention helps easily understand structure dataset: _df: standard data frame. _ts: time series object. _list: list object. Brasil_females_df: Brazilian Female Demographics & Mortality data frame containing population counts mortality information females Brazil, disaggregated federal states abridged age groups, years 1991 2000. manaus_ts: Monthly Average Heights Rio Negro Manaus univariate time series monthly average river heights Rio Negro Manaus. series contains 1080 observations spanning 90 years, January 1903 December 1992. Yellow_Fever_list: Yellow Fever Outbreak Brazil list object containing information flow Yellow Fever cases five Brazilian states outbreak period December 2016 May 2017.

title: Access Brazilian Data via APIs and Curated Datasets
code: # Load the package library(BrazilDataAPI)  # Selected, essential information about Brazil get_country_info_br()  # Get List of Banks in Brazil get_brazil_banks()  # Load a dataset data("Brasil_females_df")  # Shows six rows of the dataset head(Brasil_females_df)  # Display the structure of the dataset str(Brasil_females_df)  # Shows the whole dataset  View(Brasil_females_df)

title: Brazilian Female Demographics & Mortality (1991-2000) — Brasil_females_df
text: dataset, Brasil_females_df, data frame containing population counts mortality information females Brazil, disaggregated federal states abridged age groups, years 1991 2000. dataset includes 486 observations 8 variables. Population counts reported years, deaths given average counts intercensal period. Age groups follow pattern 0, 1, 5, ..., 75, open age group 80+. total 53 Brazilian states represented.

title: Brazilian Female Demographics & Mortality (1991-2000) — Brasil_females_df
Brazilian Female Demographics & Mortality (1991-2000) — Brasil_females_df
text: data frame 486 observations 8 variables: cod Integer code identifying federal state pop1 Population count 1991 (integer) pop2 Population count 2000 (integer) deaths Average number deaths intercensal period (numeric) year1 First census year (1991; integer) year2 Second census year (2000; integer) age Abridged age group (integer values like 0, 1, 5, ..., 75; open age group 80) sex Sex identifier; values "f" (character)

title: Brazilian Female Demographics & Mortality (1991-2000) — Brasil_females_df
text: Data taken DDM package version 1.0-0

title: Brazilian Female Demographics & Mortality (1991-2000) — Brasil_females_df
text: dataset name kept 'Brasil_females_df' avoid confusion datasets R ecosystem. naming convention helps distinguish dataset part BrazilDataAPI package assists users identifying specific characteristics. suffix 'df' indicates dataset data frame. original content modified way.

title: Brazilian Male Demographics & Mortality (1980-1991) — Brasil_males_df
text: dataset, Brasil_males_df, data frame containing population counts mortality information males Brazil, disaggregated federal states abridged age groups, years 1980 1991. dataset includes 486 observations 8 variables. Population counts reported years, deaths given average counts intercensal period. Age groups follow pattern 0, 1, 5, ..., 75, open age group 80+. total 53 Brazilian states represented.

text: Data taken DDM package version 1.0-0

Additionally, package includes curated datasets related Brazil, covering topics demographic data,river levels, environmental emission factors, film festivals, yellow fever outbreak records.

what: Films Shown at Brazilian Film Festivals (2007–2011) — Brazil_films_df
title: Films Shown at Brazilian Film Festivals (2007–2011) — Brazil_films_df
text: dataset, Brazil_films_df, data frame containing information films shown five different film festivals Brazil 2007 2011. dataset includes 25 observations 6 variables, summarizing number films, directors, male female directors, regional categories year.

title: Films Shown at Brazilian Film Festivals (2007–2011) — Brazil_films_df
Films Shown at Brazilian Film Festivals (2007–2011) — Brazil_films_df
text: data frame 25 observations 6 variables: year Year film festival (integer) regE Festival region (factor 5 levels) F Number films shown (integer) D Number directors (integer) MD Number male directors (integer) WD Number female directors (integer)

title: Films Shown at Brazilian Film Festivals (2007–2011) — Brazil_films_df
text: Data taken bpca package version 1.3-6

title: Films Shown at Brazilian Film Festivals (2007–2011) — Brazil_films_df

what: Get List of Banks in Brazil — get_brazil_banks
title: Get List of Banks in Brazil — get_brazil_banks
text: function retrieves list banks Brazil BrasilAPI endpoint: `https://brasilapi.com.br/api/banks/v1`. response includes key details bank code, name, ISPB (identificador sistema de pagamentos).

title: Get List of Banks in Brazil — get_brazil_banks
Get List of Banks in Brazil — get_brazil_banks
text: tibble (data frame) following columns: code: Bank code (integer). name: Short name bank. fullName: Full registered name bank. ispb: ISPB code (Identificador Sistema de Pagamentos Brasileiros).

title: Get List of Banks in Brazil — get_brazil_banks
text: Requires internet connection. function pulls data real time BrasilAPI.

title: Get List of Banks in Brazil — get_brazil_banks

what: Get Address Information by Brazilian CEP (Postal Code) — get_brazil_cep
title: Get Address Information by Brazilian CEP (Postal Code) — get_brazil_cep
text: function retrieves detailed address information given Brazilian postal code (CEP) using BrasilAPI endpoint.

title: Get Address Information by Brazilian CEP (Postal Code) — get_brazil_cep
Get Address Information by Brazilian CEP (Postal Code) — get_brazil_cep
text: cep valid Brazilian postal code (CEP) 8 digits (e.g., "89010025").

title: Get Address Information by Brazilian CEP (Postal Code) — get_brazil_cep
text: data frame (tibble) following columns: cep: CEP (postal code). state: State abbreviation (e.g., SP, RJ). city: City municipality. neighborhood: Neighborhood. street: Street name. service: Name API service used.

title: Get Address Information by Brazilian CEP (Postal Code) — get_brazil_cep
text: Example URL format: https://brasilapi.com.br/api/cep/v1/89010025 Replace 89010025 valid Brazilian postal code (CEP). function sends GET request BrasilAPI CEP endpoint. request successful response contains expected fields, returns structured tibble. Otherwise, message displayed NULL returned.

title: Get Address Information by Brazilian CEP (Postal Code) — get_brazil_cep
text: Requires internet connection. Make sure CEP correctly formatted (digits, 8 characters).

title: Get Address Information by Brazilian CEP (Postal Code) — get_brazil_cep
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Look up information for a specific CEP get_brazil_cep("89010025") } # }

what: Get Brazil's Under-5 Mortality Rate from World Bank — get_brazil_child_mortality
title: Get Brazil's Under-5 Mortality Rate from World Bank — get_brazil_child_mortality
text: Retrieves Brazil's -5 mortality rate, measured number deaths children five years age per 1,000 live births, years 2010 2022 using World Bank Open Data API. indicator used SH.DYN.MORT.

title: Get Brazil's Under-5 Mortality Rate from World Bank — get_brazil_child_mortality
Get Brazil's Under-5 Mortality Rate from World Bank — get_brazil_child_mortality
text: World Bank Open Data API: https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SH.DYN.MORT

title: Get Brazil's Under-5 Mortality Rate from World Bank — get_brazil_child_mortality
text: tibble following columns: indicator: Indicator name (e.g., "Mortality rate, -5 (per 1,000 live births)") country: Country name ("Brazil") year: Year data (integer) value: Mortality rate (per 1,000 live births)

title: Get Brazil's Under-5 Mortality Rate from World Bank — get_brazil_child_mortality
text: function sends GET request World Bank API. API request fails returns error status code, function returns NULL informative message.

title: Get Brazil's Under-5 Mortality Rate from World Bank — get_brazil_child_mortality
text: Requires internet connection.

title: Get Brazil's Under-5 Mortality Rate from World Bank — get_brazil_child_mortality

what: Get Company Information by CNPJ (Brazil) — get_brazil_cnpj
title: Get Company Information by CNPJ (Brazil) — get_brazil_cnpj
text: function retrieves public company registration data Brazil querying BrasilAPI endpoint.

title: Get Company Information by CNPJ (Brazil) — get_brazil_cnpj
Get Company Information by CNPJ (Brazil) — get_brazil_cnpj
text: cnpj valid CNPJ number string (digits, punctuation).

title: Get Company Information by CNPJ (Brazil) — get_brazil_cnpj
text: tibble selected essential fields: cnpj: CNPJ identifier. razao_social: Legal name. nome_fantasia: Trade name. capital_social: Registered capital (numeric). data_inicio_atividade: Start date activities. cnae_fiscal_descricao: Main economic activity. natureza_juridica: Legal nature. descricao_situacao_cadastral: Registration status. municipio: City. uf: State. cep: Postal code. logradouro: Address (street). numero: Address number. bairro: Neighborhood.

title: Get Company Information by CNPJ (Brazil) — get_brazil_cnpj
text: Example URL format: https://brasilapi.com.br/api/cnpj/v1/19131243000197 Replace 19131243000197 valid Brazilian CNPJ number. returns tibble essential information company's legal name, trade name, address, primary activity, registration status. function makes HTTP GET request BrasilAPI CNPJ endpoint processes JSON response structured tibble. returns fields essential informative user.

title: Get Company Information by CNPJ (Brazil) — get_brazil_cnpj
text: Requires internet connection. function returns NULL CNPJ invalid found.

title: Get Company Information by CNPJ (Brazil) — get_brazil_cnpj

what: Get Official Public Holidays in Brazil for a Given Year — get_brazil_holidays
title: Get Official Public Holidays in Brazil for a Given Year — get_brazil_holidays
text: Retrieves list official public holidays Brazil specific year using Nager.Date public holidays API. function returns tibble containing date holiday, name local language (Portuguese), English name. useful academic, planning, data analysis purposes. information retrieved directly Nager.Date API reflects current status holidays requested year. field names returned consistent API structure.

title: Get Official Public Holidays in Brazil for a Given Year — get_brazil_holidays
Get Official Public Holidays in Brazil for a Given Year — get_brazil_holidays
text: Data obtained Nager.Date API: https://date.nager./

title: Get Official Public Holidays in Brazil for a Given Year — get_brazil_holidays
text: year integer indicating year (e.g., 2024 2025).

title: Get Official Public Holidays in Brazil for a Given Year — get_brazil_holidays
text: tibble following columns: date: Date holiday (class Date) local_name: Holiday name local language (Portuguese) name: Holiday name English

title: Get Official Public Holidays in Brazil for a Given Year — get_brazil_holidays

what: Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info
title: Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info
text: Retrieves selected, essential information Brazil country full name. data retrieved REST Countries API. See API documentation https://restcountries.com/. Example API usage: https://restcountries.com/v3.1/name/brazil?fullText=true.

title: Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info
Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info
text: name Full country name (common official). example: "Brazil", "Peru", "France".

title: Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info
text: data frame 8 columns: name_common: Common name country. name_official: Official name country. capital: Capital city. region: Geographic region. subregion: Subregion. population: Total population. area: Total area square kilometers. languages: Official languages, separated commas.

title: Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info
text: function returns readable details country's common official name, capital, region, subregion, population, area, official languages. function sends GET request REST Countries API. request successful (HTTP 200), parses JSON extracts key fields. country found error, function returns NULL user-friendly message.

title: Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info

what: Monthly Average Heights of the Rio Negro at Manaus (1903–1992) — manaus_ts
title: Monthly Average Heights of the Rio Negro at Manaus (1903–1992) — manaus_ts
text: dataset, manaus_ts, univariate time series monthly average river heights Rio Negro Manaus. series contains 1080 observations spanning 90 years, January 1903 December 1992. value represents monthly average daily stages (heights) Rio Negro. Manaus located 18 km upstream confluence Rio Negro Amazon River, due minimal slope flatland affluents, measurements can considered good approximation water level confluence.

title: Monthly Average Heights of the Rio Negro at Manaus (1903–1992) — manaus_ts
Monthly Average Heights of the Rio Negro at Manaus (1903–1992) — manaus_ts
text: univariate time series class ts 1080 monthly observations 1903 1992: values Monthly average river heights (numeric)

title: Monthly Average Heights of the Rio Negro at Manaus (1903–1992) — manaus_ts
text: Data taken boot package version 1.3-31

title: Monthly Average Heights of the Rio Negro at Manaus (1903–1992) — manaus_ts
text: dataset name kept 'manaus_ts' avoid confusion datasets R ecosystem. naming convention helps distinguish dataset part BrazilDataAPI package assists users identifying specific characteristics. suffix 'ts' indicates dataset time series object. original content modified way.

title: Emission Factors from the Environmental Agency of São Paulo (CETESB) — sp_emission_factors_df
text: dataset, sp_emission_factors_df, data frame containing emission factors Environmental Agency São Paulo (CETESB), including equivalencies European (EURO) vehicle emission standards. dataset includes 288 observations 10 variables, covering pollutants, vehicle age type, classification systems Proconve EURO light-duty heavy-duty vehicles.

title: Emission Factors from the Environmental Agency of São Paulo (CETESB) — sp_emission_factors_df

what: Yellow Fever Outbreak in Brazil (Dec 2016 – May 2017) — Yellow_Fever_list
title: Yellow Fever Outbreak in Brazil (Dec 2016 – May 2017) — Yellow_Fever_list
text: dataset, Yellow_Fever_list, list object containing information flow Yellow Fever cases five Brazilian states outbreak period December 2016 May 2017. data include epidemiological statistics number cases, population, dates first last recorded cases, well travel-related matrices indicating disease importation exportation.

title: Yellow Fever Outbreak in Brazil (Dec 2016 – May 2017) — Yellow_Fever_list
Yellow Fever Outbreak in Brazil (Dec 2016 – May 2017) — Yellow_Fever_list
text: list 4 elements: states data frame 5 observations 5 variables, including location code, population, number cases, dates first last reported cases T_D 5x10 numeric matrix travel destinations (disease importation probabilities) T_O 5x10 numeric matrix travel origins (disease exportation probabilities) length_of_stay named numeric vector average length stay per destination

title: Yellow Fever Outbreak in Brazil (Dec 2016 – May 2017) — Yellow_Fever_list

title: Yellow Fever Outbreak in Brazil (Dec 2016 – May 2017) — Yellow_Fever_list

title: BrazilDataAPI 0.2.0
text: get_country_info() renamed get_country_info_br() avoid naming conflicts packages improve function identification. following APIs added BrazilDataAPI package: Nager.Date https://date.nager./Api. World Bank API https://datahelpdesk.worldbank.org/knowledgebase/articles/889392 following functions added BrazilDataAPI package: get_brazil_child_mortality(): Get Brazil’s -5 Mortality Rate data World Bank. get_brazil_cpi(): Get Brazil’s Consumer Price Index (2010 = 100) data World Bank. get_brazil_energy_use(): Get Brazil’s Energy Use (kg oil equivalent per capita) data World Bank. get_brazil_gdp(): Get Brazil’s GDP (current US$) data World Bank. get_brazil_hospital_beds(): Get Brazil’s Hospital Beds (per 1,000 people) data World Bank. get_brazil_life_expectancy(): Get Brazil’s Life Expectancy Birth data World Bank. get_brazil_literacy_rate(): Get Brazil’s Adult Literacy Rate data World Bank. get_brazil_population(): Get Brazil’s Total Population data World Bank. get_brazil_unemployment(): Get Brazil’s Total Unemployment Rate data World Bank. get_brazil_holidays(): Get official public holidays Brazil given year.

title: BrazilDataAPI 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-07-09

title: BrazilDataAPI 0.1.0
text: First release BrazilDataAPI package. Added view_datasets_BrazilDataAPI() function explore available datasets. Curated Collection datasets cover diverse aspects Brazilian society. Initial APIs BrasilAPI REST Countries API – Added functions powered APIs
